chapter.d: In the distant future, mankind will go extinct leaving Doggos as the most prosperous creature.
Doggos of all shapes and sizes will possess talents no humans could dream of having today.
A company called DOGGO NEEDS INC. will have a monopoly over almost everything.
At the same time Doggos will live in a most captivating futuristic world.
But one Doggo will almost completely surpass the rest.
And his name will of course be..... Doggo.
Doggo woke up. They'd been staying at the K-9 hotel now for longer than they'd hoped.
Doggo stared out the window at the sun long enough for it to harm his health.
It was a perfect day for a walk.
Doggo dug up his old robot and had it walk it at its pace of choice.
Not long after they'd started, they got hungry.
Fortunately they were only about a block away from their favorite supplier of treats, DOGGO NEEDS INC.
Doggo waltzed into the store exhausted from the walk, and started searching for treats.
On display near the center of the shop was a treat labeled "THE ULTIMATE TASTY TREAT".
Doggo stared at it for awhile. It appeared to glow.
Signs surrounded the display. "Remember citizens of 'DOGGO NEEDS' district; all thieves regardless of crime will be TICKLED TO THEIR DOOM".
Without thinking, Doggo stole the treat. It was odd because up to this point he'd been a model citizen.
He also stole a car parked outside the shop, and soon him and his robot dog were in a high speed chase with a bunch of cops.
Doggo had escaped the police for the time being...
He and his "dog" had hidden in a place so barren, so bleak, and so derelict that the police would not find them there.
It seemed like a perfect place to hide, but even so they could not stay there long.
It lacked most of the basic needs of living things.
When Doggo ventured far enough across this land, he came across something completely unexpected.
There was a building with a group of doggos inside.
"Hey! Who's out there?!", one of them yelled.
Doggo figured he would answer since he had nothing to lose.
"My name's Doggo. I'm here because I'm hiding from DOGGO NEEDS. I stole a treat".
Only then did Doggo realize DOGGO NEEDS rewarded citizens who helped them catch criminals.
Doggo wasn't very bright. "Wait!! please don't turn me in!".
"It's okay", one of the other doggos spoke. "We're all criminals too. We help each other".
And so, Doggo joined the unnamed revolutionary group without knowing what was to come...
The only problem Doggo had with the group's ideals was that members couldn't leave the group. Rule number twenty nine was: "once a member, always a member".
No matter what happened, members of the group faced every problem encountered together. Besides this, however, Doggo enjoyed having someone to watch their back.
The group had no leader, so they simply decided what they would do next together. Doggo seemed to have a lot of influence since he was a new member.
Every time they left the desert land they were chased by the doggo police. They left the desert land a lot so they could get food and water.
Sometimes they drove on the wrong side of the road to escape them, but then it was almost impossible to escape crashing.
The group didn't believe they had the power to vanquish DOGGO NEEDS, but they had to be strong enough to survive and defy the monopoly's rule at the same time.
Doggo ends up getting all the treats he wants, but the catch is that he can't eat any of them.
The Doggo police all retire as there is no need to enforce the law.
DOGGO NEEDS INC. loses its monopoly on everything, and eventually goes out of business.
The revolutionary group members are unsatisfied with what happened to DOGGO NEEDS, and continue to annoy its founders.
Other random civilians find a new enjoyment in their everyday lives.
After Doggo made it clear he wasn't dedicated to the cause and broke rule number twenty nine, the group gave chase.
Doggo has been driving ever since...
